snippet: New York City has reached a tentative contract deal with the union representing school principals that would raise their salaries substantially and give them retroactive pay, Mayor Bill de Blasio announced on Saturday.
abstract: New York City reaches tentative contract deal with union representing school principals that would increase their pay by 18 percent over nine years and give them retroactive pay.
lead_paragraph: New York City has reached a tentative contract deal with the union representing school principals that would raise their salaries substantially and give them retroactive pay, Mayor Bill de Blasio announced on Saturday.

headline.main: New York’s Deal With Principals’ Union Includes Back Pay
headline.print_headline: New York’s Deal With Principals’ Union Includes Back Pay
